market_summary: Broad risk-off tape in mega-cap growth/AI today: MSFT -0.38%, NVDA -2.71%, AMZN -2.61%, GOOGL -1.00%, META -2.70%, AVGO -3.81% (all as of 2026-02-12 20:39Z).
Defensive/healthcare showed relative strength today: UNH +2.20%, LLY +2.23%.

Single-name headline risk noted in META newsflow (Russia/WhatsApp block threat); otherwise most items in the last ~72h are secondary commentary rather than company-filed releases (per fetched news lists).

thesis_damage_flags.why: Regulatory/geopolitical headline risk: news item indicates Russia moving to block WhatsApp and threatens Meta with permanent ban (Benzinga, 2026-02-12). Could pressure engagement/monetization expectations in affected region.

Negative sector-tape catalyst in newsflow: "tech stocks ... wiped out $500B" headline (Benzinga, 2026-02-12) suggests risk of near-term multiple compression for large-cap semis; not company-specific but can impact 30-day momentum.

thesis: Current 10 names are mega/large-cap quality compounders with strong profitability/returns: e.g., MSFT OM ~48.8%, NVDA OM ~62.3%, GOOGL OM ~39.6%, META OM ~42.8% (from fetched key ratios snapshots).
Diversified cross-sector exposure (IT, Comm Svcs, Cons Disc, Financials, Energy, Health Care) keeps sector risk under the 35% cap while maintaining a quality + momentum profile.

Near-term pullback across AI/megacap today improves forward entry for existing weights without forcing a low-evidence swap; strongest negative headline (META Russia/WhatsApp) is currently not quantified in fundamentals in fetched data.
risks: Concentration risk to AI/megacap sentiment: multiple IT/Comm Services names moved down 1–4% today (as of snapshot time).
Valuation risk in semis/GLP-1 leaders: NVDA P/E ~45.9, AVGO P/E ~67.3, LLY P/E ~54.0 (fetched key ratios snapshots).
Idiosyncratic regulatory/geopolitical risk (META) and competitive risk in obesity drugs (LLY vs competitors cited in newsflow).
falsifiable_checks: If META regulatory/geopolitical issues escalate into measurable revenue/engagement impact (e.g., repeated new restrictions in additional markets), reassess and consider Replace at next rebalance.
If the AI/semiconductor complex continues to underperform for multiple weeks (momentum deterioration) while defensives lead, reassess IT weight vs sector cap and rotate within constraints.
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Next 6–18 months likely remain defined by AI capex cycle + cloud/platform monetization, balanced by policy/regulatory uncertainty and rotation risk. With limited verified catalyst data beyond price snapshots, ratios, and mixed news headlines, the most deterministic decision is to hold exposures and avoid low-evidence churn into unverified alternatives.

constraints_check.notes: 10 holdings; weights sum to 100%. Min position 8% (>=2%), max position 12% (<=20%). Sector weights: Information Technology 34% (MSFT 12 + NVDA 12 + AVGO 10), Communication Services 18% (GOOGL 10 + META 8), Consumer Discretionary 10% (AMZN 10), Financials 10% (JPM 10), Energy 10% (XOM 10), Health Care 18% (UNH 9 + LLY 9). All sectors <=35%.
